messages.content:
Morning @everyone  ! 
Let‚Äôs start the day ! 

This is a good article and example about how even without the knowledge of coding we can use AI to help us improve our jobs and life: 

I‚Äôll be more than happy to read each one of your takeaways !

Headline: Canva is now in the coding and spreadsheet business
Source / Date: The Verge, April 10, 2025
Link: https://www.theverge.com/news/646682/canva-visual-suite-2-0-ai-spreadsheets-creative-workspace

Quick‚ÄØSummary: Canva‚Äôs Visual Suite 2.0 introduces AI-powered tools like Canva Code and Canva Sheets, enabling users to create websites, apps, and spreadsheets using simple text prompts‚Äîno coding required. This expansion transforms Canva into a comprehensive platform, allowing individuals without technical backgrounds to build and collaborate on digital projects seamlessly.

Takeaway: With AI tools like Canva‚Äôs, turning your ideas into digital reality is just a prompt away‚Äîno coding skills needed. 

Discussion Questions:
    1.    How might Canva‚Äôs new AI features impact the way non-developers approach digital project creation?
    2.    What are the potential benefits and challenges of relying on AI-generated code and spreadsheets for business tasks?
    3.    In what ways can tools like Canva‚Äôs Visual Suite 2.0 democratize access to technology and innovation?

I'm not a regular user of Canva, so my first thought in reading this article was "why would they try to re-create spreadsheets and word docs and powerpoints, those are already done just fine elsewhere" but in reflecting on it, it makes more sense. Seems like they're trying to increase share of wallet with their customers so they'll stay in the Canva platform rather than copying and pasting from other places. Seems like most AI companies are focusing on creating an integrated vertical experience as their main go-to-market strategy. This makes sense with venture capitalist views I've heard that AI native companies will replace entire workflows and price on outputs, aligning price much more closely with the value it creates.

<@758206516753858561> This is such a great post. I learnt something new. I had used Canva to make invitation cards, or edit PDF. I didnt know about its AI capabilities until I read this post. Great learning for me.

At first I thought the same ! Then I remember my wife used to use Canva to some simple designs for her business, and I thought how much could this help her too. She‚Äôs the perfect example of no knowledge of coding whatsoever hehe
I‚Äôm glad you find it useful !! My wife it‚Äôs gonna love it too as soon as show this to her. She uses Canva the same way you do !

**Headline:** Four Ways to Build AI Tools Without Knowing How to Code  
**Source / Date:** Lifehacker, June 18, 2024  
**Link:** https://lifehacker.com/the-best-ways-to-build-ai-tools-without-knowing-how-to-1850535556

**Quick‚ÄØSummary:** This article introduces user-friendly platforms that enable individuals to create AI applications without any coding experience. Tools like Lobe allow users to train machine learning models through simple interfaces, making AI development accessible to all.

**Takeaway:** You don't need to be a programmer to harness the power of AI‚Äîyour ideas and creativity are the only prerequisites.

**Discussion Questions:**
1. How do no-code AI tools like Lobe democratize access to technology for non-programmers?
2. What are the potential limitations of using no-code platforms for developing AI applications?
3. In what ways can educators and professionals integrate no-code AI tools into their work to enhance productivity and innovation?

Good moorning @everyone ! here is a good topic for Discussion ! regarding learning without coding skills !

**Headline:** How I'd Learn AI in 2025 (If I Knew Nothing)  
**Source / Date:** Medium, January 2025  
**Link:** https://medium.com/data-science/how-id-learn-ai-in-2025-if-i-knew-nothing-0496dc9ab54c

**Quick‚ÄØSummary:** This article outlines a beginner-friendly approach to learning AI in 2025, emphasizing the use of no-code tools and AI assistants. It provides a step-by-step guide for non-technical individuals to start exploring AI concepts and applications without prior coding experience.

**Takeaway:** In 2025, the barrier to entry for learning AI has significantly lowered‚Äîcuriosity and willingness to explore are your most valuable tools.ÓàÜ

**Discussion Questions:**
1. What are the most accessible no-code tools available for beginners to start learning AI in 2025?
2. How can non-technical professionals leverage AI to enhance their work or personal projects?
3. What challenges might beginners face when learning AI without coding, and how can they overcome them?

Hope to hear from you !

Good Morning ! @everyoneand Welcome everyone to our <#1360642371531968582> channel ! Headline: How to Make AI Work for You, at Work
Source / Date: TIME, August 9, 2023
Link: https://time.com/6302984/ai-jobs-career/​:contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}

Quick‚ÄØSummary: This article highlights how professionals without coding backgrounds are leveraging AI tools to enhance their work. By taking accessible courses like "Elements of AI," individuals from various fields are gaining foundational AI knowledge, enabling them to utilize AI effectively in their careers.‚Äã

Takeaway: You don't need to be a programmer to harness AI‚Äîcuriosity and the right resources are your keys to unlocking its potential.‚Äã

Discussion Questions:

How can non-coders identify AI tools that best suit their professional needs?

What are the benefits and challenges of integrating AI into non-technical workflows?

In what ways can foundational AI knowledge empower professionals across various industries?

Hey @everyone!! , Today, thursday and within Discord as part of our weekly activities and opportunities to grow, the various channels and buddy groups are submitting a question for Dr Abel Sanchez's Friday Q&A Forum. Ill leave you this Article, hope you can find it Helpful ! and ill love to hear your thoughts about it too.

**Headline:** How to Learn AI in 2025: A Guide for Beginners  
**Source / Date:** DigitalOcean, April 10, 2025  
**Link:** https://www.digitalocean.com/resources/articles/how-to-learn-ai 

**Quick‚ÄØSummary:** This beginner-friendly guide breaks down the branches of AI‚Äîlike machine learning and natural language processing‚Äîand highlights accessible tools and resources to get started. It emphasizes that prior coding experience isn't necessary, offering pathways for individuals from various backgrounds to engage with AI technologies effectively.

**Takeaway:** AI is no longer exclusive to coders; with the right resources, anyone can harness its power to innovate and solve real-world problems.

**Discussion Questions:**
1. What are some no-code tools mentioned in the article that can help beginners start learning AI?
2. How can understanding the different branches of AI assist non-technical individuals in applying AI to their fields?
3. What challenges might beginners face when learning AI without coding, and how can they overcome them?
